text.0: Out of the 65 recorded #COVID19 cases among WHO HQ staff to date, 49 have occurred in the last 8 weeks, in line with the epidemiological situation in Geneva and surrounding areas.
text.1: WHO staff who were confirmed positive with #COVID19 in Geneva have received the necessary medical attention. WHO carried out full contact tracing and related protocols. Enhanced cleaning protocols were implemented in relevant offices.
text.2: Since the start of the pandemic, a total 65 WHO staff stationed in Geneva - working from home and onsite - have tested positive for #COVID19. We have not yet established whether any transmission has occurred on campus, but are looking into the matter.
text.4:
"Health like the climate crisis, inequality and conflict cannot be tackled in siloes. 

A new collective way forward is needed to ensure that we deliver on the promises of the past and tackle these intertwined challenges together"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.5: "To reflect this, last week I launched a new Council on the Economics of #HealthForAll, to be chaired by distinguished economist @MazzucatoM, to put universal health coverage at the centre of how we think about value creation and economic growth"-@DrTedros
text.6:
"This cannot be business as usual. 

The time has come for a fundamental shift toward health being seen as an investment, rather than a cost, and the foundation of productive, resilient and stable economies"-@DrTedros #ACTogether 

https://t.co/UV7GGQ9DjH
text.7:
"@g20org leaders will meet this weekend.

This is an opportunity for them to commit financially & politically to the ACT-Accelerator & COVAX so that together we can end this pandemic quickly.

It’s also a moment for us to strive for the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: we want"-@DrTedros #ACTogether #COVID19
text.8: "With countries spending trillions to prop up economies, COVAX represents the best possible deal as it will mean a quicker recovery for all and an end to stimulus"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.9: "This is very substantial, but to ensure that tools are rolled out quickly across the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: so that we save lives, stabilize health systems & drive a truly global recovery, another $4.2 billion is needed urgently & a further $23.9 billion will be required in 2021"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.10:
"The @EU_Commission, France, Spain, The Republic of Korea and the @gatesfoundation pledged $360 million to COVAX, the vaccines pillar of the ACT-Accelerator. 

New contributions bring the total committed to $5.1 billion"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.11:
"Last week, leaders came together at both the #WHA73 and the @ParisPeaceForum. 

High on the agenda was the ACT-Accelerator & ensuring equitable access to new rapid tests, therapeutics and #COVID19 vaccines"-@DrTedros
text.12:
"A laissez-faire attitude to the virus – not using the full range of tools available – leads to death, suffering and hurts livelihoods and economies.

It’s not a choice between lives or livelihoods. The quickest way to open up economies is to defeat the virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.13:
"There is no excuse for inaction. 

My message is very clear: act fast, act now, act decisively"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.14:
"From calling up students, volunteers & even national guards to support the health response in times of crisis, to putting strict measures in place that allow pressure to be removed from the health system"-@DrTedros #COVID19 

https://t.co/trShaZPdQx
text.15: "We need to do everything we can to support #healthworkers, keep schools open, protect the vulnerable and safeguarding the economy"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.16:
"#HealthWorkers went into medicine to save lives.

We must avoid putting them into situation where they have to make impossible choices about who gets care and who doesn’t"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.17:
":keycap_digit_one:there will be further needless deaths & suffering
:keycap_digit_two:we are seeing a significant number of people experiencing long-term effects of the virus
:keycap_digit_three::woman_health_worker_selector::adult:‍:medical_symbol_selector::man_health_worker_selector: are facing extreme #mentalhealth pressure & cases are severely burdening health systems in too many countries"-@DrTedros
text.18:
"This is a dangerous virus, which can attack every system in the body. 

Those countries that are letting the virus run unchecked are playing with fire"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.19:
"And where #COVID19 cases are starting to come down, keep investing so that you’re prepared"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/JvioIhmPHz
text.20:
"Invest in a well trained & protected public health workforce so that you have enough contact tracers in place & ensure that those who are sick can isolate away from others & contacts are identified, notified & managed properly"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/5IRgXIdnaY
text.21: "As countries take extreme measures to curb the rapid spread of #COVID19, now is the time to invest in the systems that will prevent further waves of the virus"-@DrTedros
text.22:
"And in just two days, in part down to active case finding and contact tracing, they will be able - I hope - to call an end to the most recent #Ebola outbreak"-@DrTedros #DRC 

https://t.co/H5JJK2Uf4J
text.23: "During recent #Ebola outbreaks, the #DRC and WHO have invested in people and trained up a sizeable number of contract tracers who work closely with local leaders and communities"-@DrTedros
text.24:
"Cluster investigations and contract tracing are part of the bedrock of a successful public health response. 
These actions help prevent individual #COVID19 cases from becoming clusters, and clusters turning into community transmission"-@DrTedros
text.25: "We’ve seen that those countries which invested in #COVID19 case finding, care and isolation, cluster investigations, adequate testing with rapid results, contact tracing and supported quarantine are facing much less disruption"-@DrTedros
text.26: "In this moment when some governments have put all of society restrictions in place, there is once again a narrow window of time to strengthen key systems"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.27:
"#HealthWorkers on the frontlines have been stretched for months. They are exhausted. 

We must do all we can to protect them, especially during this period when the virus is spiking and patients are filling hospital beds"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.28:
"That there are enough masks, gloves & other protective equipment.

That governments have access to enough tests, therapeutics & supplies to cope with demand now.

That health systems will be ready when safe & effective vaccines are rolled out"-@DrTedros

https://t.co/Pho7FtzgIL
text.29:
"WHO & partners are working with governments & health leaders to ensure that there is cover for #healthworkers that are sick. 

That there are enough beds for #COVID19 patients & for essential health services to continue safely"-@DrTedros
text.30:
"WHO has issued guidance & tools to increase capacity for the medical & public health workforce & supplies & facilities to manage #COVID19 patients.
WHO has 150 emergency medical teams assisting countries in the planning & implementation of their emergency responses"-@DrTedros
text.31:
"Right now we are extremely concerned by the surge in #COVID19 cases we’re seeing in some countries. Particularly in Europe and the Americas, #healthworkers and health systems are being pushed to the breaking point"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/srTabidSSS
text.32:
"This is not the time for complacency. 

While we continue to receive encouraging news about #COVID19 vaccines & remain cautiously optimistic about the potential for new tools to start to arrive in the coming months"-@DrTedros
text.34:
#PrimaryHealthCare:hospital: can meet most health needs throughout people's lifetime, delivering 

:white_heavy_check_mark:better health outcomes
:white_heavy_check_mark:value for money
:white_heavy_check_mark:improved quality of care 

Research on primary health care is needed to achieve Universal Health Coverage globally :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/QeSHw9dJyk https://t.co/VNNdmkOH8g
text.35:
#PrimaryHealthCare:hospital: is a foundation for #HealthForAll. It's the best way to ensure everyone everywhere receives the services they need. 

Read the latest WHO Bulletin :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/1eutyNzjOk https://t.co/k9Wb86dXRe
text.36:
A vaccine on its own will not end the #COVID19 pandemic. We will still need to continue:
-Surveillance 
-Testing, isolating & caring for cases 
-Tracing & quarantining contacts
-Engaging communities
-Encouraging individuals to be careful 
#ACTogether #EB147
text.37: Initial supply of #COVID19 vaccines will be limited, so #healthworkers, older people & other at-risk populations will be prioritised. That will hopefully reduce the number of deaths & enable health systems to cope, but the virus will still have a lot room to move. #EB147
text.38: Since the beginning of the #COVID19 pandemic, we knew that a vaccine would be essential for bringing the pandemic under control. But it’s important to emphasise that a vaccine will complement the other tools we have, not replace them. #EB147 #ACTogether
text.40:
"We still have a long road to travel & you as our Executive Board have a vital role to play.  
We look to you for guidance and advice on how we in the Secretariat can better support all Member States to break the chains of transmission and save lives"-@DrTedros #EB147
text.41:
"But that will still leave the virus with a lot of room to move. Still:
-Surveillance will need to continue
-Ppl will need to be tested, isolated & cared for
-Contacts will need to be traced & quarantined
-Communities will need to be engaged & individuals to be careful"-@DrTedros
text.42:
"A vaccine on its own will not end the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Initially, supply will be limited, so #healthworkers, older people & other at-risk populations will be prioritised.  

That will hopefully reduce the number of deaths & enable health systems to cope"-@DrTedros #EB147
text.43: "Since the beginning of the pandemic, we knew that a vaccine would be essential for bringing #COVID19 under control, which is why WHO proposed the ACT-Accelerator. It’s important to emphasise that a vaccine will complement the other tools we have, not replace them"-@DrTedros
text.44: "Commitments to the ACT-Accelerator have now reached more than USD 5 billion, thanks to new contributions from France, Spain, the Republic of Korea, the European Commission and the @gatesfoundation announced at the @ParisPeaceForum"-@DrTedros #EB147
text.45:
"...
Some have had large #COVID19 outbreaks and have managed to bring them under control

And some are still facing large outbreaks with sustained community transmission"-@DrTedros #EB147
text.46:
"The Member States represented in this #EB147 represent the full range of experiences with #COVID19. 

Some of your nations have not yet recorded a single case, or a single death

Some have had clusters of cases, but have avoided widespread transmission
..."-@DrTedros
text.47: "The new results framework, which was noted by the #WHA73, and the “triple billion” dashboard will be important tools for keeping ourselves accountable"-@DrTedros #EB147 https://t.co/BnKW30naiL
text.48: "Although the #COVID19 pandemic has been a setback to our collective efforts to attain the “triple billion” targets and the health-related @GlobalGoalsUN, we in the Secretariat remain completely committed to supporting Member States to get back on track"-@DrTedros EB147
text.49:
"We are now developing each of these concepts and we will shortly be sharing more information about how Member States can engage with them"-@DrTedros #EB147 

https://t.co/WiEJwhfAe9
text.50:
"I announced 3 new initiatives to further strengthen both natl. capacities & WHO’s efforts to support them.
:keycap_digit_one:Universal Health & Preparedness Review
:keycap_digit_two:Council on the Economics of #HealthForAll 
:keycap_digit_three:idea of a new “biobank” for sharing pathogens & clinical samples"-@DrTedros #EB147
text.51:
"#WH73 declared 2021 the International Year of the Health Worker"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/DHPhCIKHBn
text.52:
"#WH73 adopted important resolutions on
Emergency preparedness
Meningitis
Neglected tropical diseases
Epilepsy & other neurological disorders
Immunization
Cervical cancer
Tuberculosis
Healthy ageing
Innovation & intellectual property
Eye care
Food safety"-@DrTedros #EB147
text.53:
"Although we had hoped to hold the resumed #WHA73 in person, this was not possible. 
Together we have shown that with the aid of modern technologies, the work of the organization can continue even in the most extreme circumstances"-@DrTedros #EB147
